text: A wickedly funny explanation of #Brexit. At least *most* Brits still have a sense of humour. (Thanks to @brentgofftv for the link.)
author: _alexforrest

text: An interesting read on why the UK should look again at the changing geopolitical environment since the 2016 Referendum. #Brexit
author: _alexforrest

text: I salute you for your forensic work. I admit that even though I am obsessed with this subject, I am finding it hard to follow!
author: _alexforrest

text: But there is no way they will take any responsibility.
author: _alexforrest

text: Watch #Merkel speak live ahead of EU summit (English translation) #Brexit
author: _alexforrest

text: #Brexit to cost billions in income losses across Europe with UK & #Germany worst hit.
author: _alexforrest

text: Enjoying watching footage of political hacks trying to doorstep an unusually quiet @BorisJohnson. Full marks for perseverance to @carldinnen @faisalislam @ChrisMasonBBC and co. Top political questions included: Boris, What did you have for breakfast? #BrexitChaos
author: _alexforrest

text: #Merkel on British Parliamentary procedure... (I think she’s not alone!) #brexit
author: _alexforrest

text: Hmm. I’m not sure many British political pundits were either!
author: _alexforrest

text: Thanks for spotting that Pete!
author: _alexforrest

text: My latest piece for @Berlinpolicy on this never ending #Brexit saga. Bercow Bombshell Creates Even More Brexit Drama https://berlinpolicyjournal.com/bercow-bombshell-creates-even-more-brexit-drama/ …
author: _alexforrest

text: I am now on my third rewrite of a piece for @BerlinPolicy that I thought I’d finished yesterday! Will there ever be an end to this madness? #BrexitMayhem
author: _alexforrest

text: I know! The on-line booking system didn’t work last October so my husband spent 4 hours queuing for them. Worth it though!
author: _alexforrest

text: Last night at Berlin’s Philharmonic, watching @SirSimonRattle conduct Bach’s St John’s Passion. Wow. And the drama brought to life by the extraordinary choir and soloists of @RundfunkchorB. Thank you for reminding us how creative and talented humans can be.
author: _alexforrest

text: Yes, I think you’re now right.
author: _alexforrest

text: Another hardline Brexiteer realising it’s May’s deal or it’s possibly no Brexit at all. But will it be enough to get her the votes she needs next week? #BrexitVote
author: _alexforrest

text: A great pity if the Tory party continues to lose moderates like you. It may please the local associations but in the longer term, it will surely damage the brand.
author: _alexforrest

text: Given the news that you’ve quit your local association, I guess an apology really was for the birds. More proof the Tory party has split in two. The membership may want Brexiteers but do most voters? What a sorry state of affairs.
author: _alexforrest

text: Same time next week then?! See you there.
author: _alexforrest

text: This is very funny. “And then we head to Brussels. Feel that dignity washing away, right through your Irish backstop.” #brexit
author: _alexforrest

text: I’m amazed at how the hardcore Brexiteers just don’t seem to get it. It’s like they don’t want Brexit at all. If @michaelgove can vote for the deal, how the hell can’t the others? (And I say that as a Brit living in Berlin who is no fan of Brexit at all.)
author: _alexforrest

text: And what about certain British media outlets who thought it in the ‘public interest’ to show footage of this barbaric act of terrorism and murder? As a journalist myself I am disgusted at their behaviour and hope they are punished.
author: _alexforrest

text: And perhaps an apology from some of your local party members?
author: _alexforrest

text: What a dad!
author: _alexforrest

text: This is wonderful.
author: _alexforrest
